title: Rapid Industrial Growth
description: In 2022, Guyana experienced an impressive industrial growth rate of 98.53%, indicating a booming sector that significantly contributes to the country's economic expansion.

title: Minimal CO2 Emissions from Waste
description: As of 2023, Guyana's carbon dioxide emissions from waste are among the lowest globally, at just 0.0001 Mt CO2e, highlighting the country's low environmental impact from waste.

title: Low Reliance on Hydroelectric Power
description: In 2021, only 0.0008% of Guyana's electricity was generated from hydroelectric sources, indicating a minimal reliance on this renewable energy form.

title: High Vulnerability to Sea Level Rise
description: In 2015, 78.48% of Guyana's population lived in areas below 5 meters elevation, making the country highly susceptible to the impacts of rising sea levels.

title: Limited Industrial Design Innovation
description: In 2021, Guyana had only 1 resident industrial design application, reflecting limited innovation and design activity within the country.

title: High GDP Deflator
description: In 2023, Guyana's GDP deflator was 91.02, suggesting significant inflationary pressures within the economy.
